nodes.bodyText: @Sara4994 I think we shouldn't have anything linked with the domain specific model, regarding the management console is general purpose and need to be able to handle different domains.
oops, thats my bad. I have just corrected these.
@Sara4994 we need to avoid this domain specific at the schema regarding the MC need to handle general purpose process

@Sara4994 I'm not sure about this are the only jobs status that could be rescheduled.  To me makes sense to cancel a job and reschedule it once the admin see is possible. I'm thinking in provide some way to retake the job from the management console.  The only ones that I see couldn't be rescheduled should be the 'EXECUTED'. Could you confirm this with @tiagodolphine?
@nmirasch  I remember when we discussed with Tiago, he said that jobs with status error and executed can be rescheduled. I made a note of it. Anyway will check one more time with him

@Sara4994 Does it makes sense put the two modal ( for details and reschedule ) in the same component when they don't share too much and add this checks over the whole component ? I see here we need different component for each one at least to include the modal content.

@Sara4994 Does it makes sense put the two modal ( for details and reschedule ) in the same component when they don't share too much and add this checks over the whole component ? I see here we need different component for each one at least to include the modal content.

@nmirasch  this is done
whitespace formatting after if
missing check for what happens after the click here.
@jstastny-cz check added 👍
again, what happens now?
@jstastny-cz actually we don't need this button simulation here, as it is moved to JobsRescheduleModal later on. I have removed it now
What issues do these 2 overrides solve?

add space in both aria attributes so that we don't have
aria-label="Job Detailsmodal"
aria-labelledby="pf-modal-part-0 Job Detailsmodal"

in snapshot
component type does not reflect component name.
can you again explain what issues these 2 overrides are solving?
These overrides are intended to avoid error appears on lines 111, 118, and 125  with ['onChange']. One of the errors is "object access via string literals is disallowed (no-string-literal)"
I think we should check what happens after the onChange  ... otherwise I am not sure what we're actually testing here.
@jstastny-cz done

@@ -0,0 +1,139 @@
+import React from 'react';
+import JobsRescheduleModal from '../JobsRescheduleModal';
+import { GraphQL, getWrapper } from '@kogito-apps/common';
+import { InfoCircleIcon } from '@patternfly/react-icons';
+import { Button } from '@patternfly/react-core';
+import { act } from 'react-dom/test-utils';
+jest.mock('react-datetime-picker');
+// tslint:disable: no-string-literal
+// tslint:disable: no-unexpected-multiline
+const props = {
+  actionType: 'Job Reschedule',
+  job: {
+    id: '6e74a570-31c8-4020-bd70-19be2cb625f3_0',
+    processId: 'travels',
+    processInstanceId: '5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced',
+    rootProcessId: '5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced',
+    status: GraphQL.JobStatus.Executed,
+    priority: 0,
+    callbackEndpoint:
+      'http://localhost:8080/management/jobs/travels/instances/5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced/timers/6e74a570-31c8-4020-bd70-19be2cb625f3_0',
+    repeatInterval: 1,
+    repeatLimit: 3,
+    scheduledId: '0',
+    retries: 0,
+    lastUpdate: '2020-08-27T03:35:50.147Z',
+    expirationTime: '2020-08-27T03:35:50.147Z'
+  },
+  modalTitle: (
+    <>
+      <InfoCircleIcon
+        className="pf-u-mr-sm"
+        color="var(--pf-global--info-color--100)"
+      />
+      {'Jobs Reschedule'}
+    </>
+  ),
+  isModalOpen: true,
+  handleModalToggle: jest.fn(),
+  modalAction: [
+    <Button key="cancel-reschedule" variant="secondary">
+      Cancel
+    </Button>
+  ]
+};
+const props2 = {
+  actionType: 'Job Reschedule',
+  job: {
+    id: '6e74a570-31c8-4020-bd70-19be2cb625f3_0',
+    processId: 'travels',
+    processInstanceId: '5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced',
+    rootProcessId: '5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced',
+    status: GraphQL.JobStatus.Executed,
+    priority: 0,
+    callbackEndpoint:
+      'http://localhost:8080/management/jobs/travels/instances/5c56eeff-4cbf-3313-a325-4c895e0afced/timers/6e74a570-31c8-4020-bd70-19be2cb625f3_0',
+    repeatInterval: null,
+    repeatLimit: null,
+    scheduledId: '0',
+    retries: 0,
+    lastUpdate: '2020-08-27T03:35:50.147Z',
+    expirationTime: '2020-08-27T03:35:50.147Z'
+  },
+  modalTitle: (
+    <>
+      <InfoCircleIcon
+        className="pf-u-mr-sm"
+        color="var(--pf-global--info-color--100)"
+      />
+      {'Jobs Reschedule'}
+    </>
+  ),
+  isModalOpen: true,
+  handleModalToggle: jest.fn(),
+  modalAction: [
+    <Button key="confirm-selection" variant="primary">
+      OK
+    </Button>
+  ]
+};
+
+Date.now = jest.fn(() => 1592000000000); // UTC Fri Jun 12 2020 22:13:20
+describe('Job details modal tests', () => {

nodes.bodyText: do we need this function considering the one we call actually? Wouldn't be just calling handleRescheduleAction in right place do the trick?
